title: The Open Mind - The Open Mind (1969) (1993 reissue) (320kbps)
description:
The Open Mind - "The Open Mind" (1969) (320kbps rip of 1993 reissue, including "Magic Potion" 45)

The band was formed in the mid-1960s by four musicians from Putney, South London. Initially named The Drag Set, they released a little-known single in February 1967: "Day and Night" / "Get Out of My Way".

Shortly after, they changed their name to The Open Mind, and in July 1969 released a self-titled LP which has since become highly sought by collectors.  This band produced one of the finest UK psychedelic albums.  The music is characterised by strong psychedelic guitar work, and powerful vocals and drumwork.

This reissue includes the band's second rare 45 release (August 1969), for which the band is best known, and which - unlike the first - wasn't taken from the album. It is superb: "Magic Potion" is a blistering 45 with great psychedelic fuzz guitar work.

Tracklist:

01 Dear Louise
02 Try Another Day
03 I Feel the Same Way Too
04 My Mind Cries
05 Can't You See
06 Thor the Thunder God
07 Magic Potion (bonus) (second single, A-side, not on original LP)
08 Horses and Chariots (first single A-side)
09 Before My Time (first single B-side)
10 Free as the Breeze
11 Girl I'm So Alone
12 Soul and My Will
13 Falling Again
14 Cast A Spell (bonus) (second single, B-side, not on original LP)

The Open Mind:
Mike Brancaccio: Guitar/Vocals
Timothy De Feu: Bass
Phil Fox: Drums
Terry Martin: Guitar/Vocals

(*Jon Anderson, who went on to form Yes, briefly sang in the band but left before the recordings.)
